Setting.Name: Graphics API
Setting.Description: Sets Rendering Software. Auto determines the best choice based on your GPU. Crashes may occur using OpenGL with AMD cards.

Setting.Name: Resolution
Setting.Description: Sets the window size for the game. Auto uses game resolution in windowed mode or current desktop resolution in fullscreen mode.

Setting.Name: Window Mode
Setting.Description: Display the game in either a standard window, or borderless fullscreen.

Setting.Name: Aspect Ratio
Setting.Description: Preserve aspect ratio adds black borders as needed to preserve a 4:3 aspect ratio.

Setting.Name: Antialiasing
Setting.Description: Applies 2x or 4x MSAA filtering. Reduces jagged edges and improves image quality. Can severely impact performance.

Setting.Name: Anisotropic Filtering
Setting.Description: Applies a filter to high resolution textures producing a sharper image. Can impact performance due to increased memory usage

Setting.Name: Vertical Sync
Setting.Description: Sync the frame rate of the game with the monitor refresh rate. May negatively impact performance or break 60 fps mods. Turn on if you experience screen tearing. *Limits Speed Hack!*

Setting.Name: NTSC-J Gamut Mode
Setting.Description: Simulate the color gamut of the 1990s Japanese television sets that FF8 was originally designed for.

Setting.Name: Use Gamepad Icons
Setting.Description: Use icon textures for gamepad buttons instead of "B1", "B2", etc. By default the PS1 icons are used from the game data.

Setting.Name: Random Battles
Setting.Description: Not configurable. Toggle on/off random battle encounters while playing the game.{0}Usage: 'CTRL+B' or 'L3, then Circle'

Setting.Name: Skip Movies
Setting.Description: Not configurable. Immediately skips to end of a movie.{0}Usage: 'CTRL+S' or 'L3, then Square'

Setting.Name: Soft Reset
Setting.Description: Not configurable. Quickly reset the game with a game over. *Do not reset during battle.*{0}Usage: 'CTRL+R' or 'L3, then Select+Start'

Setting.Name: Speed Hack Stepping
Setting.Description: Amount to increase or decrease speed on each trigger.{0}Usage: 'CTRL+Up/Down' or 'L3, then L1/R1' to change speed, 'CTRL+Left/Right' or 'L3, then L2/R2' to turn on/off.

Setting.Name: Speed Hack Max
Setting.Description: The maximum speed to set before cycling back to normal speed.

Setting.Name: Show Debug Info
Setting.Description: Displays realtime information about the rendering process/performance on an overlay or in the title bar.

Setting.Name: Show Driver Version
Setting.Description: Displays the currently used driver version on an overlay or in the title bar.

Setting.Name: Show FPS
Setting.Description: Displays the current Frames Per Second on an overlay or in the title bar.

Setting.Name: Show Graphics API
Setting.Description: Displays the currently used Graphics API (OpenGL/DirectX11) on an overlay or in the title bar.

Setting.Name: Internal Resolution Scaler
Setting.Description: Multiply 640x480 internal resolution by following amount. Higher values need more powerful GPU. Higher values can remove scaling artefacts, * Values are optimal performance quality tradeoff.
